article_title: William Galston: A Fight Obama Needs to Have With Democrats
article_text:
This year may be the most consequential one for trade agreements in a generation. It is all but certain to be the most combative—although America’s top negotiator is optimistic about the outcome.

Unless the negotiations unexpectedly run off the rails, a draft Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement should be on the table for congressional consideration by Labor Day. Well before that, the House and Senate will debate the reauthorization of the Export-Import Bank, which has staunch friends and ardent foes in both parties. Later...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, William Glaston writes that the president must work hard for the ‘fast track’ authority he needs to make vital trade deals.
twitter.title: A Fight Obama Needs to Have With Democrats

article_metadata.author: William A. Galston
article_metadata.article.origheadline: A Fight Obama Needs to Have With Democrats

article_summary:
Unless the negotiations unexpectedly run off the rails, a draft Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement should be on the table for congressional consideration by Labor Day.
Well before that, the House and Senate will debate the reauthorization of the Export-Import Bank, which has staunch friends and ardent foes in both parties.
It is all but certain to be the most combative—although America’s top negotiator is optimistic about the outcome.
This year may be the most consequential one for trade agreements in a generation.
